title: Capaldi Recipe Box
text: A collection of recipes from Picinisco to York to Florida

title: Pain de Campagne
text:
A basic sourdough bread recipe inspired by King Arthur Flour Co.




450g bread flour
50g whole wheat flour
400g water
10g salt
20g (1 tbsp) sourdough discard



Combine all ingredients by hand into wet shaggy mess
Wait 15 mins then fold dough 3 times
Cover to proof on counter for 12+ hours
Lay dough out on floured surface

Optional: Cover dough with adjuncts (olives, sun dried tomatoes, etc.)

Shape into a round, cover, and rest for 15-20 mins
Shape into a batard, place in floured baneton, and rest in fridge for 8 hours
Preheat bread pan in oven to 450° F


Flip dough from baneton to parchment paper and score the top with lame
Place dough in hot pan, add a drop water each side, place lid on, and place in oven
Bake for 20 mins lid on, then 25 mins lid off

title: Pizza Dough
text:
Flavorsome dough ready for heat of the pizza oven inspired by King Arthur Flour Co.


300g all purpose flour
225g sourdough discard
150g water
5g salt



Combine all ingredients by hand into wet dough
Knead for 10 minutes until dough is smooth and less sticky
Drizzle olive oil in bowl then return dough to rest for 4+ hours on counter
Divide, hand stretch, add toppings, and slide into the oven!

title: Naan Bread
text:
Fluffy sourdough naan bread with optional fillings. Pair peshwari naan with tandori chicken for Matt’s favorite Indian take away.





300g all purpose flour
125g sourdough discard
75g Greek yogurt
50g milk
50g water
5g salt
1/2 stick of melted butter (to baste naan)
For garlic naan; 3 cloves minced garlic, 1/2 bunch cilantro (add to butter)
For peshwari naan; 1/4 cup shaved coconut, coconut oil, honey, & sugar (stuff naan)




Combine all ingredients (except butter and flavorings) by hand into wet dough
Knead for 10 minutes until dough is smooth (still a little sticky)
Rise for 2 hours on counter then in the fridge until ready to cook


Preheat cast iron skillet on medium heat
Hand stretch dough into naan shapes

Optional: If stuffed naan, add stuffing, fold over, and reshape

Brush top side of naan with melted butter then place that side down in the hot skillet
Cook for 3 mins per side, brushing second side with butter before flipping

title: Classic Sourdough
text:
A basic sourdough bread recipe inspired by King Arthur Flour Co.





450g bread flour
50g whole wheat flour
400g water
10g salt
20g (1 tbsp) sourdough discard




Combine all ingredients by hand into wet shaggy mess
Wait 15 mins then fold dough 3 times
Cover to proof on counter for 12+ hours
Lay dough out on floured surface

Optional: Cover dough with adjuncts (olives, sun dried tomatoes, etc.)

Shape into a round, cover, and rest for 15-20 mins
Shape into a batard, place in floured baneton, and rest in fridge for 8 hours

Flip dough from baneton to parchment paper and score the top with lame
Place dough in hot pan, add a drop water each side, place lid on, and place in oven
Bake for 20 mins lid on, then 25 mins lid off

title: Lasagne
text:
A slight twist on a classic dish perfect for an Italian Christmas Eve


1 pack of lasagne sheets
1/2 cup parmesan cheese (to sprinkle on top)
Meat sauce

Spicy Italian sausage (or sweet)
1 red onion
3 cloves garlic
2 tbsp dried sofrito
1 tbsp paprika
1 tbsp oregano, thyme, & basil
1 eggplant
1 poblano chili or other mild chili (optional)
1 large can plum tomatoes
250ml full-bodied dry red wine

White sauce

12oz mascarpone



White sauce (cont.)

3/4 cup parmesan
1/2 cup milk
Nutmeg to taste (optional)




Fry off onion & garlic until soft
Add herbs and seasonings and cook for 1 min
Add sausages fry until brown
Add eggplant fry until soft
Deglaze the pan with red wine for 1 min
Add the tomatoes and turn heat down to simmer
Mix cheese sauce ingredients in a large bowl
Layer large rectangular dish with 1/3 sauce
Coat lasagne sheets in cheese sauce then layer on top
Repeat 7 and 8 until out of sauce
Sprinkle parmesan cheese on top
Bake on 350° F for 30 mins until edges start to brown
